revised_title: Ultraviolet Astronomy and Interstellar Gas Observations
tldr: This article discusses a discussion held in 1975 on astronomy in the ultraviolet, focusing on observations of the interstellar gas using the Copernicus satellite. The satellite's ultraviolet scanning spectrometer allowed researchers to detect various ions and molecules in the interstellar gas, providing insights into the composition and properties of the interstellar medium. The findings have implications for understanding the universe's density, the formation of deuterium, and the distribution of elements in interstellar clouds.
